snippet: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s insistence on a direct role, citing a “historical responsibility” that Iraq rejects, is undermining American goals in the region....
abstract: Turkish Pres Tayyip Recep Erdogan's insistence on playing role in battle to retake city of Mosul from Islamic State has been met with alarm and resistance from Iraqi government, creating dispute that complicates already fraught operation; Turkey has already angered Iraq and undermined its sense of sovereignty by stationing troops within its borders without permission.

byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and MICHAEL R. GORDON
byline.contributor: Ceylan Yeginsu and Safak Timur contributed reporting from Istanbul, and Omar Al-Jawoshy from Baghdad.

lead_paragraph: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s insistence on a direct role, citing a “historical responsibility” that Iraq rejects, is undermining American goals in the region.

headline.main: Turkey’s Push to Join Battle for Mosul Inflames Tension With Iraq
headline.print_headline: Turkey Treads on Iraq’s Toes in Tussle Over Role at Mosul

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
